item_description: Resuscitation of a patient provided for at least 2 hours, by a specialist in the practice of the specialistâ€™s specialty of emergency medicine at a recognised emergency department of a private hospital, in conjunction with an attendance on the patient by the specialist described in item 5001, 5004, 5011, 5012, 5013, 5014, 5016, 5017 or 5019 (Anaes.)
rationale: The note describes a concussion following a bicycle accident with reassurance and education, no resuscitation, and no indication of prolonged emergency intervention. There is no evidence of resuscitation or any activity lasting at least 2 hours.
citations: Patient 11 years old with history of bicycle accident involving head and leg impact, with brief loss of consciousness.
Management: Reassurance, education on short-term and long-term effects of concussion; advice to return to ED if concerns arise in next 24-48 hours.
